history.content:
response from Prof. Eli Yablonovitch:

    EE117 covers advanced undergraduate electromagnetics, recommended for juniors and seniors, culminating in understanding how a cellphone antenna works, electromagnetically.  
    How does a cellphone capture and radiate electromagnetic signals?  Along the way, we learn how Hertz sent radio across the English Channel one year, and across the Atlantic Ocean in the following year.

    Sorry for the out-of-date online course description.
        Eli Y.

Hey, what are the opinions on these classes? I have taken equivalents to all the lower div physics classes, and up to math 54, and I have a fair bit of CS and EE classes under my belt. I do enjoy math, but cant really find much about these classes except the really old class pages. What are these classes like, and should I consider taking them? Thanks.
history.subject: [RECOMENDATION] ee117 and ee118
